channel.title: Impro with two Axoloti Sampler Instruments
channel.description: Hey all! I´ve uploaded a Video from a little Studio Session using two Axoloti Sampler Instruments that I made. The first one you hear is a very simple Sampler with 8 Audio Buffers, Pitchcontroll and a Step Sequencer. The second sampler you here is more like a Granular thing. There I already sampled some Trumpet Notes in advance. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NkXF1oZzSsw&feature=youtu.be

item.title: Impro with two Axoloti Sampler Instruments
item.dc:creator: @kryshe Christian Grothe
item.description:
@kryshe wrote:

Yes so the Sampler that I used to Sample the Percussion is this one:
Slice Sampler.axp (66.2 KB)
And the one that is doing the "Pad Sound" with the sampled trumpet is this one here:
samplerpoly9stereo.axp (66.0 KB)

Actually they are both quite "simple" but what I like about the simplicity is that it brings so much inspiration and creativity. Sometimes I think about buying a device like an MPC or another more "HiFi" Sampler but I think all these options that those devices bring, that I am not able to build by myself, will more block my creativity. So I will keep on building my own little devices =) And I would be very gratefull for hints how to improve these samplers =)

Read full topic
item.source: Impro with two Axoloti Sampler Instruments
